intro: Scabiosa argentea subsp. ucranica, commonly known as the silver scabious, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features silver-white, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
